content:
ObjectList Class

Definition

Enables you to specify multiple fields for display, per item in an object list. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultEvent("ItemCommand")]
[System.ComponentModel.DefaultProperty("DataSource")]
[System.ComponentModel.Designer(typeof(System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.ObjectListDesigner))]
[System.ComponentModel.Editor(typeof(System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.ObjectListComponentEditor), typeof(System.ComponentModel.ComponentEditor))]
[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItem("System.Web.UI.Design.WebControlToolboxItem, System.Design, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a")]
[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
[System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder(typeof(System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListControlBuilder))]
[System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DesignerAdapter(typeof(System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.Adapters.DesignerObjectListAdapter))]
[System.Web.UI.ToolboxData("<{0}:ObjectList runat="server" LabelStyle-StyleReference="title" CommandStyle-StyleReference="subcommand"></{0}:ObjectList>")]
public class ObjectList : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.PagedControl, System.Web.UI.INamingContainer, System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ITemplateable

Remarks

Much of the behavior of the ObjectList, including support for templated rendering through device template sets and internal pagination, is similar to the behavior of the List. For more information, see the Introduction to the ObjectList Control or the Pagination documentation.

Constructors

ObjectList()

Creates a new instance of the ObjectList class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public ObjectList ();

Properties

AllFields

Returns the collection of all fields from the ObjectList class, whether explicit or automatically generated. The default value is the collection of automatically generated fields. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection AllFields { get; }
Value
IObjectListFieldCollection

An IObjectListFieldCollection object containing all fields in the ObjectList.

Remarks

This collection is available only after data binding. Unlike the Fields collection, you cannot add or remove items in this collection. By default, this collection is the set of automatically generated fields. If any fields are explicitly defined, they are contained after any automatically generated fields.

AutoGenerateFields

Specifies whether fields must be automatically generated from data. When enabled, each public property of the data becomes a field of the control. The default value is true. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public bool AutoGenerateFields { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the fields are automatically generated from data; otherwise, false.

Remarks

When true, the object list handles the fields order in the ObjectListFieldCollection collection. When false, you must specify the order of the fields and set the DataItem property to bind to a data source.

BackCommandText

Gets or sets the text used for the command to return from the Details view (accessed through a softkey or link). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public string BackCommandText { get; set; }
Value
String

The text used for the command to return from the Details view.

Remarks

The default text is "Back".

Note

This label is displayed on WAP browsers and in HTML view.

Commands

Gets the collection of commands in the ObjectList object. Initially, the collection is empty. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandCollection Commands { get; }
Value
ObjectListCommandCollection

The collection of commands in the object list.

CommandStyle

Gets or sets the style used for the object list commands. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style CommandStyle { get; set; }
Value
Style

The style used for the object list commands.

Remarks

If this property is programmatically set, it is not persisted unless the property is set dynamically on each request. If the property is set declaratively, the property is set on each request. There is no default.

Since different devices have different requirements for styles. You may want several DeviceSpecific settings for the CommandStyle property.

DataMember

Gets or sets the data member to extract when data binding to a list data source. The default value is an empty string (""). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual string DataMember { get; set; }
Value
String

The data member to extract from the data source when data binding to an ObjectList.

Remarks

This property is only used if the value of the DataSource property is of type IListSource, rather than of type IEnumerable.

DataSource

Gets or sets the data source of the list that is being bound. The default value is null. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual object DataSource { get; set; }
Value
Object

The data source of the list that is being bound.

Remarks

To bind a data source to a list, you must first use the control's DataBind method to ensure data binding. The data source can be of type IEnumerable or of type IListSource. If the data source is of type IListSource, you can use the DataMember field to specify which member to extract.

DefaultCommand

Gets or sets the name of the default command. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public string DefaultCommand { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the default command.

Remarks

When set, the ObjectList control attempts to render a shortcut to invoke the default command. In HTML, the default rendering in list view displays the first field as a link to the details view of the ObjectList. When the DefaultCommand property is set, clicking the link invokes the default command. Invoking the default command raises the ItemCommand event. The CommandName of the ObjectListCommandEventArgs object is set to the value of the DefaultCommand property.

Even if a default command is defined, you should include a command with the same name in the commands collection. If the control cannot render a graphical element that includes a shortcut for the default command, the default command is still available through the rendering of the ObjectList commands collection.

Details

Returns the panel that contains a device-specific details view. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Panel Details { get; }
Value
Panel

A panel that contains a device-specific details view.

Exceptions
Exception

the current view is not the details view.

Remarks

The details view has a table that lists each field title and value. In addition, it lists all the commands associated with an item. For some devices, this view also contains a link that returns the user to the list view.

DetailsCommandText

Gets or sets the text used for the menu item that shows the details view. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public string DetailsCommandText { get; set; }
Value
String

The text used for the menu item that shows the details view.

Remarks

If you attempt to set a string that is longer than can be displayed, the default value is displayed. The default text is "Go".

Note

This label is displayed only on WAP browsers.

Fields

Gets the collection of explicitly defined fields in the ObjectListFieldCollection class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListFieldCollection Fields { get; }
Value
ObjectListFieldCollection

The collection of explicitly defined fields for the object list control.

Remarks

You can add or remove fields in the collection by using the Add, AddAt, Remove, and RemoveAt methods of the ObjectListFieldCollection class.

HasItemCommandHandler

Gets a value indicating whether the ObjectList control has an event handler registered for the appropriate ItemCommand event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public bool HasItemCommandHandler { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the object list control has an event handler registered for the appropriate ItemCommand event; otherwise, false.

InternalItemCount

Gets the number of items in the control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override int InternalItemCount { get; }
Value
Int32

None.

Items

Gets the collection of items in an ObjectListItemCollection list. The default value is an empty collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListItemCollection Items { get; }
Value
ObjectListItemCollection

The collection of items in the object list.

Remarks

You can inspect the items in the ObjectListItemCollection collection, but you cannot modify the collection.

LabelField

Gets or sets a value (the name or data field) that identifies the field to use as a label for each item. The default value is empty, which causes the first field in the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.AllFields* collection to be used as a label for each item. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public string LabelField { get; set; }
Value
String

The name or data field that identifies the field to use as a label for each item.

Remarks

This property is ignored if the list view is shown as a table.

LabelFieldIndex

Gets the index in the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.AllFields* collection of the field that has been set by the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.LabelField* property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public int LabelFieldIndex { get; }
Value
Int32

The index within the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.AllFields* collection of the field that is used as the label. The default value is zero.

Remarks

If the LabelField property has not been set, LabelFieldIndex returns zero.

LabelStyle

Gets or sets the style used for the header label. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style LabelStyle { get; set; }
Value
Style

The style used for the header label.

Remarks

Setting this property in code is not persisted between requests, so if you want the style to be consistently set, you must set the property on each request. If the property is set declaratively, the property is persisted between requests. In addition, setting the property declaratively allows you to use a DeviceSpecific/Choice structure to set the property for various devices.

MoreText

Gets or sets the text string used for the More link used on HTML browsers to navigate to the details view. The default is More or the localized equivalent. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public string MoreText { get; set; }
Value
String

The text string used for the More link used on HTML browsers to navigate to the details view.

Remarks

The More link is rendered to provide a link from the ListView of the ObjectList to the DetailsView of the ObjectList. The following conditions must be met for the More link to be rendered:

  • The DefaultCommand property must be set.

  • There must be additional fields or commands to be rendered in the details view.

    The default rendering of the ObjectList displays the first field in the ListView as a link to the DetailsView page. Setting the DefaultCommand property overrides this link and causes it to raise the ItemCommand event. As a result, the More link is rendered to provide a link to the DetailsView.

Note

This property is not the same as the DetailsCommandText property, which is used on WAP browsers.

SelectedIndex

Returns the index of the selected item. The default value is -1. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public int SelectedIndex { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The index of the selected item.

Exceptions
Exception

an attempt to clear this property was made while the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.ViewMode* property was not set to ObjectListViewMode.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

the value is less than zero or larger than or equal to the number of items in the list.

Remarks

Multiple selections are not supported. Set this property to -1 to clear the selection.

Selection

Returns the selected item, or null if there is no selection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListItem Selection { get; }
Value
ObjectListItem

The selected item, or null if there is no selection.

Remarks

Multiple selections are not supported.

SelectMoreCommand

Gets the text used for the command to select more items in an ObjectList. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public static string SelectMoreCommand { get; }
Value
String

The text used for the command to select more items in an object list.

TableFieldIndices

Gets an array of indices within the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.AllFields* collection of the fields in the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.TableFields* property. The default value is null. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public int[] TableFieldIndices { get; }
Value
Int32[]

An array of integers representing the indices of the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.AllFields* collection.

Remarks

If the ObjectList control has not been bound to a data source or no items have been added, the TableFieldIndices property returns null.

TableFields

Gets or sets which fields are visible when the list view is shown in table mode. The default value is an empty string (""). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public string TableFields { get; set; }
Value
String

A semicolon-delimited list of fields to be displayed when the list view is shown in table mode.

Remarks

This string must be a set of identifiers, separated by semicolons. Each identifier indicates the name or data field of the field that will be displayed. By default, the list view is never shown in table mode unless this property is not empty.

ViewMode

Gets or sets the view mode of an ObjectList. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListViewMode ViewMode { get; set; }
Value
ObjectListViewMode

An ObjectListViewMode value representing the view mode of the object list.

Exceptions
Exception

An attempt was made to set this property to a value other than ObjectListViewMode while no item was selected.

Remarks

The following options are available for this property through the ObjectListViewMode enumeration.

Member Name Description
ObjectListViewMode This is the default view displayed when the page containing the object list is rendered for the first time. It consists of either the label fields of the items, or if the TableFields property is not empty, a table with columns corresponding to the table fields and rows for the items. In HTML, this view is combined with the Commands view, with the commands appearing as hyperlinks below the list. When there is more information in the Details view, a hyperlink for each item displaying the Details view is rendered.
ObjectListViewMode In HTML, this view is combined with the Commands view, with the commands appearing as hyperlinks below the details.
ObjectListViewMode This view is rendered separately only for WML devices. It consists of a menu with the commands of the ObjectList. For HTML devices, the List view and Details view are each combined with this view, with the commands appearing as hyperlinks below the details or list.
Note

To set this property in code, an item in the list must be selected before setting this property to ObjectListViewMode or ObjectListViewMode view. An attempt to set the property before selecting an item throws an exception.

A view mode is persisted in a private view state, so that, regardless of whether the EnableViewState property of the ObjectList object is true, the view mode is persisted as a private field. However, if the EnableViewState property is false, the items collection is not persisted between requests, requiring a data bind to be repeated for each request.

Methods

AddParsedSubObject(Object)

Notifies the server control that an element, either XML or HTML, was parsed, and adds the element to the server control's stem.Web.UI.Control.Controls* property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void AddParsedSubObject (object obj);
obj
Object

None.

Automatically generates fields for the given data. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected void CreateAutoGeneratedFields (System.Collections.IEnumerable dataSource);
dataSource
IEnumerable

The specified source of the data.

CreateChildControls()

Notifies server controls to create any child controls in preparation for posting back or rendering. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void CreateChildControls ();

CreateItem(Object)

Creates a list item to contain the object and binds it to the specified object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListItem CreateItem (object dataItem);
dataItem
Object

The list item to bind.

Returns
ObjectListItem

An object list item created from the specified object.

Remarks

Inheriting classes can override this method to provide a different way of creating an item, or can call this method to construct an item.

CreateItems(IEnumerable)

Creates items in an items collection from the specified dataSource parameter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void CreateItems (System.Collections.IEnumerable dataSource);
dataSource
IEnumerable

The source from which items in the collection are created.

Remarks

Inheriting classes can override this method for custom data-binding behavior.

CreateTemplatedItemDetails(Boolean)

Constructs the details view for the current item by using the ItemDetailsTemplate. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void CreateTemplatedItemDetails (bool doDataBind);
doDataBind
Boolean

Returns true if the instantiated templates must bind to available data (which usually happens on the first request). Returns false if the templates must not bind to data, and instead rely on view state to have them filled in (which usually happens on subsequent postbacks).

Remarks

Called by device adapters when rendering templates.

CreateTemplatedItemsList(Boolean)

Constructs the list view by building templates. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void CreateTemplatedItemsList (bool doDataBind);
doDataBind
Boolean

Returns true if the instantiated templates must bind to available data (which usually happens on the first request). Returns false if the templates must not bind to data, and instead rely on view state to have them filled in (which usually happens on subsequent postbacks).

Remarks

Called by device adapters when rendering templates.

DataBind()

Binds a data source to the ObjectList. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void DataBind ();

EnsureChildControls()

Determines whether the server control contains child controls. If it does not, it creates child controls. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void EnsureChildControls ();

EnsureTemplatedUI()

Use this method to ensure that the templates are instantiated to allow programmatic access to the instantiated contents of a template. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void EnsureTemplatedUI ();

LoadPrivateViewState(Object)

Loads private view state. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void LoadPrivateViewState (object state);
state
Object

None.

LoadViewState(Object)

Restores view-state information from a previous page request that was saved by the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.SaveViewState* method. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void LoadViewState (object savedState);
savedState
Object

None.

OnBubbleEvent(Object,EventArgs)

Determines whether the event for the server control is passed up the page's UI server control hierarchy. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override bool OnBubbleEvent (object sender, EventArgs e);
sender
Object

None.

e
EventArgs

None.

Returns
Boolean

None.

OnDataBinding(EventArgs)

Raises the DataBinding event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void OnDataBinding (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

An EventArgs object that contains the event data.

Exceptions
Exception

the data source provided no data to bind to.

Remarks

This method notifies a server control to perform any logic for binding data that is associated with it.

If you want to handle the DataBinding event, you should override this event-handling method. This ensures that all delegates attached to the DataBinding event are invoked.

OnItemCommand(ObjectListCommandEventArgs)

Called when a list item generates an event as a result of user interaction. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void OnItemCommand (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandEventArgs e);
e
ObjectListCommandEventArgs

An object (defined by ObjectListCommandEventArgs) that contains event data.

Remarks

The default implementation raises the ItemCommand event. Inheriting classes can override this method to perform other tasks.

OnItemDataBind(ObjectListDataBindEventArgs)

Called when a list item is data bound. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void OnItemDataBind (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListDataBindEventArgs e);
e
ObjectListDataBindEventArgs

An object (defined by ObjectListDataBindEventArgs) that contains event data.

Remarks

The default implementation raises the ItemDataBind event. Inheriting classes can override this method to perform other tasks.

OnItemSelect(ObjectListSelectEventArgs)

Called after the user selects an item. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void OnItemSelect (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListSelectEventArgs e);
e
ObjectListSelectEventArgs

An ObjectListSelectEventArgs object that contains event data.

Remarks

The default implementation raises the ItemSelect event. Inheriting classes can override this method to retrieve the required data.

OnLoadItems(LoadItemsEventArgs)

Called when the control is custom paginated and needs more data. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void OnLoadItems (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.LoadItemsEventArgs e);
e
LoadItemsEventArgs

None.

OnPreRender(EventArgs)

Raises the PreRender event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void OnPreRender (EventArgs e);
e
EventArgs

None.

OnShowItemCommands(ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs)

Called prior to showing the set of commands for a list item. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void OnShowItemCommands (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs e);
e
ObjectListShowCommandsEventArgs

An object defined by an EventArgs object that contains event data.

Remarks

The default implementation raises the ShowItemCommands event. Inheriting classes can override this method to perform other tasks.

PreShowItemCommands(Int32)

Prepares the set of commands for a specified item prior to showing it, by calling any event handlers that might be set on the ShowItemCommands event. Called internally by ASP.NET. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void PreShowItemCommands (int itemIndex);
itemIndex
Int32

The index reference for the item.

Remarks

You would use this method only when writing new device adapters.

RaiseDefaultItemEvent(Int32)

Called to raise an event for the default command associated with the specified item. Called internally by the ASP.NET. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void RaiseDefaultItemEvent (int itemIndex);
itemIndex
Int32

The index reference for the item.

Remarks

This method can be used by adapters.

RaisePostBackEvent(String)

Notifies the ObjectList object of a postback event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected void RaisePostBackEvent (string eventArgument);
eventArgument
String

A String that represents an optional event argument to be passed to the event handler.

SavePrivateViewState()

Saves any private view-state changes that have occurred since the page was loaded from persistence. If no changes were made, this method returns null (Nothing in Visual Basic). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override object SavePrivateViewState ();
Returns
Object

None.

SaveViewState()

Saves any server control view-state changes that have occurred since the time the page was posted back to the server. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override object SaveViewState ();
Returns
Object

None.

SelectListItem(Int32,Boolean)

Tests whether an item in an ObjectList is selected. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public bool SelectListItem (int itemIndex, bool selectMore);
itemIndex
Int32

Specifies the item to test.

selectMore
Boolean

Contains true if more than one item can be selected. Otherwise, it contains false.

Returns
Boolean

true if item is selected; otherwise, false.

TrackViewState()

Causes tracking of view-state changes to the server control so they can be stored in the server control's StateBag object. This object is accessible through the stem.Web.UI.Control.ViewState* property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected override void TrackViewState ();

Events

ItemCommand

Occurs when the user selects a command that is associated with an ObjectList item. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public event System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandEventHandler ItemCommand;

Remarks

When an ItemCommand event handler is defined, the ObjectList notifies the handler when an item event is generated through user interaction.

When you render an object list by using templates, the ItemCommand event handler is called through the event-bubbling mechanism of ASP.NET. The event handler is passed an argument of type ObjectListCommandEventArgs, which contains information about the source item and the CommandName property of the control that generated the event. This allows you to render a single item with multiple associated interactions.

On default rendering, the control renders each of the commands defined for the object list as a link. When the user clicks a link, the ItemCommand event handler is called with an argument of type ObjectListCommandEventArgs, which contains information about the source item. The value in the CommandName property is the name of the command that the user invoked.

ItemDataBind

Occurs when an item in an ObjectList is bound to data. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public event System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListDataBindEventHandler ItemDataBind;

Remarks

When an item in an ObjectList is created and data-bound, this event handler sets the properties of the list item from arbitrary expressions. An item in an ObjectList control is of type ObjectListItem.

ItemSelect

Occurs when a user selects an item from a list view. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public event System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListSelectEventHandler ItemSelect;

Remarks

This event is called before the ShowItemCommands event is called.

ShowItemCommands

Occurs before the commands related to an item in an ObjectList are shown. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public event System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListShowCommandsEventHandler ShowItemCommands;

Remarks

The event argument contains a reference to the item and to the collection of commands. An event handler can customize the collection according to the item. Applications can use the ShowItemCommands event to provide functionality equivalent to item-specific shortcut menus. Changes made to the collection of commands during this event are not persisted.

This event is called after the ItemSelect event is called. You can use this event to perform other tasks before showing the detail view. You can add, remove, or rearrange fields, depending on the item selected in the list view.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent(String)

For a description of this member, see stem.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent*. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

void IPostBackEventHandler.RaisePostBackEvent (string eventArgument);
eventArgument
String

The optional event argument to be passed to the event handler.

Remarks

This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ObjectList instance is cast to an IPostBackEventHandler interface.
